text: لقالوا۟ انما سكرت ابصرنا بل نحن قوم مسحورون

translations.translation: they would only say, 'Our eyesight is befuddled! Or rather we have been put under a spell!'
They will say all the same: "Our eyes were dazed (and clouded over). We were a people ensorcelled."
they would still have said: "Surely our eyes have been dazzled; rather, we have been enchanted."
they would have said, "Our eyes are bewildered and we have been affected by magic."
Even then they would say, “Our sights have been hypnotised – in fact, a magic spell has been cast upon us.”
They would surely say (in the evening): "Our eyes have been (as if) dazzled (we have not seen any angel or heaven). Nay, we are a people bewitched."
They would certainly say: Only our eyes have been covered over, rather we are an enchanted people.
yet would they say, 'Our eyes have been dazzled; nay, we are a people bewitched!'
They would say: Our sight is wrong - nay, but we are folk bewitched.
they would still say, "Our eyes have been dazzled. We are bewitched."
They would surely say: intoxicated have been our sights; aye! we are a people enchanted.
they would surely say, ‘Indeed a spell has been cast on our eyes; indeed, we are a bewitched lot.’
They would only say: "Our eyes have been intoxicated: Nay, we have been bewitched by sorcery."
They would surely say: "Our eyes have been (as if) dazzled. Nay, we are a people bewitched."
still they would say: 'Our eyes were dazzled; truly, we must have been a bewitched people'
They would still say, “Our eyes are hallucinating; in fact, we are people bewitched.”
They would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."
[15:15] they would say, ‘It is merely that our eyes have been dazzled, they have been shut. Nay, we are a folk bewitched!’, imagining this.
(They) the disbeliever of Mecca (would say: Our sight is wrong) our sight is gone (nay, but we are folk bewitched) our minds have been seized; we have been bewitched.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { لَقَالُواْ إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتْ أَبْصَارُنَا } معناهُ غُشِيتْ فذَهبتْ
 ويقالُ: سُكِرَتْ

translations.translation:
And His saying - exalted be He: {Their eyes did not swerve, nor did they blink} [Qur'an 52:24], its meaning is that their eyes did not swerve, meaning they did not look away, and they did not blink, meaning they did not close their eyes.


And it is said: "Sukirat"

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ لَقَالُواْ } من شدة غيهم وضلالهم: { إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتْ } وحيرت { أَبْصَارُنَا } بسحر محمد وتلبيسه
 وإنما فُعل بنا هذا
 لنؤمن له
 ونصدق قوله وكتابه
 ونقبل دينه { بَلْ } أمرنا كذلك بلا شك وتردد
 إذ { نَحْنُ } بمشاهدة هذا الفتح والعروج { قَوْمٌ مَّسْحُورُونَ } [الحجر: 15] مغبوطون مخبوطون
 لبس علينا الأمر هذا الشخصُ بالسحر والشعبذة


ثمَّ قال سبحانه امتناناً لعباده بتهيئة أسباب معاشهم: { وَلَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا } وقدرنا { فِي ٱلسَّمَاءِ بُرُوجاً } اثني عشر تدور وتتبدل فيها الشمس في كل سنةٍ شتاءً وصيفاً
 ربيعاً وخريفاً
 والقمرُ في كل شهر تتميماً لأسباب معاشكم
